result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Financial Request Form

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:19pm
INCLUDES 15CM1579, 15CM1744, 16CM1645
State appears by ADA Sidney Brubacher;  Deft appears with Atty Aaron Damrau.
  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM1579:
Ct. 1 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> D&RI
15CM1744:
Ct. 2 Operating w/ PAC >=.02 under IID order (2nd) >> dismissed outright
Ct. 3 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> D&RI
16CM1645:
Ct. 1 OWI (2nd) amended to OWI (3rd) offense
Ct. 2 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA: 
15CM1744:
Ct. 1 Operate with restricted controlled substance (2nd) >> GUILTY
16CM1645:
Amended Ct. 1 OWI (3rd)>> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM1744 Ct. 1 (OWI 2nd): Pay $1,379.00 fine inclusive of court costs (includes DNA surcharge and sample). Serve 5 days MCJ. Jail may be with huber release for work or treatment if meets jail criteria. 12 months driver license revocation, administrative credit granted for any time already served. 12 months IID to be installed immediately, time will not being to run against deft record until obtain's valid license. Legal limit 0.02. 6 points against driving record. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM1645 Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd): w/hold sentencing. 2 years probation. CONDITIONS: Pay $1,694.00 fine inclusive of court costs (including DNA surcharge and sample). Impose 125 days jail, stay 100 days jail. Serve 25 days jail pursuant to SSTOP, consecutive to 5 days jail in 15CM1744 Ct. 1. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Jail may be with huber release for work or treatment. 27 months driver's license revocation, administrative credit granted for any time already served, concurrent to 12 months DL rev. in 15CM1744 Ct. 1. 27 months IID to be installed immediately, time will not begin to run against deft record until obtain's valid license. 6 points against driving record. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobritey from drugs and alcohol. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 42 days credit granted towards OWI 3rd. 

Adj: 3:47pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea hearing on September 22, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
